title: Find the LCD of the Fractions
speech: LCD of  fraction, y minus 6, over, y squared plus 3 y minus 4,  , , fraction, 2 over, y plus 4,  , and , fraction, 7 over, y minus 1,   is  parentheses y plus 4,  times, parentheses y minus 1,  .
pacedSpeech: LCD of   fraction, y minus 6, over, y squared plus 3 y minus 4,
is    y plus 4,  times,  y minus 1,

title: Clear All Fractions
text: We must multiply each fraction by the LCD. We get $$(y-6)=2\left(y-1\right)+7\left(y+4\right)$$.
speech: We must multiply each fraction by the LCD. We get  times, parentheses y minus 6,  is equal to 2 times, parentheses y minus 1,  plus, 7 times, parentheses y plus 4,  .
pacedSpeech: We must multiply each fraction by the LCD. We get   times,  y minus 6,  is equal to 2 times,  y minus 1,  plus, 7 times,  y plus 4,

title: Simplify the Equation
text: Let's simplify this equation: $$y-6=2y-2+7y+28$$. This simplifies to $$8y=-32$$.
speech: Let's simplify this equation:  y minus 6, is equal to 2 y minus 2 plus 7 y plus 28 . This simplifies to  8 y is equal to negative 32 .
pacedSpeech: Let's simplify this equation:   y minus 6, is equal to 2 y minus 2 plus 7 y plus 28
. This simplifies to   8 y is equal to negative 32

title: Solve the Equation
text: $$-8y=32$$ becomes $$y=-4$$, which is our solution. It is extraneous, however, since it is in the denominator of the original equation. DNE.
speech: minus 8 y is equal to 32  becomes  y, is equal to negative 4 , which is our solution. It is extraneous, however, since it is in the denominator of the original equation. DNE.
